intro: Polycycliska cylindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical polycyclis, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the family Polycyclidaceae. It is characterized by its unique, elongated, and cylindrical stem structure, which is often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in clusters along the stem. It thrives in specific, nutrient-rich soils and is found in only a few isolated locations across Southeast Asia. Due to habitat loss and limited genetic diversity, it is considered a critically endangered species.
